_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This facility complies with all regulations for the handling and storage of NH3 and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Lakota Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.

This facility is a farmer owned cooperative.  We sell agricultural products to members and non-members.  We sell NH3 for the sole purpose of fertilization of farm ground.  This facility consists of two 11,000 and one18,000 gallon tank plumbed together and twenty-seven nurse tanks (five 1500 gallon and twenty-two 1000 gallon).

Our worst case scenario would be the sudden release of the three main storage tanks when they were filled to capacity.  According to EPA look-up tables, the distance to endpoint would be 3.3 miles with an approximate population of 609 people.  

Our alternate scenario would be the accidental pull-away by a receiving transport without disconnecting the transfer hose.  According to EPA look-up tables the endpoint would be 0.10miles with an approximate population of 2 people.  All employees working at this facility have been trained on how to respond to this type of scenario.

This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rules and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.

We have never had an accident involving NH3 that caused death, injuries, property or environmental damage or evacuations.

In the event of an emergency at our NH3 plant, it is our policy to notify the Lakota Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.  We have discussed this policy with the fire department and members of the fire department have inspected our NH3 facility.

There are no planned changes of our procedures or policies.
